page.title: 15Witney Feast
page.content: Witney Feast is a big fair which comes to Witney every year. It comes at the end of September on Monday and Tuesday. It is on the Leys. It starts at about 5o'clock. People come from a 25 radius to it as it is very famous. People from our class almost all went and about a third of them went on both days. People spent anything from one to thirty pounds. There were at least 33 big rides and dozens of side stalls. The rides had strange names like "The Zipper", "Orbiter","Walzer","Ski-jump" The rides are quite long, early in the evening, and get shorter later on when more people come. You pay about 50pence for about a minute and a half's ride. The old-fashioned up-and-down horse roundabout is very popular and must make about thirty pounds every two minutes. This ride is painted brightly and an old-fashioned organ plays.
